Hello I'm Kathy Sha



Welcome to my portfolio!

About Me

My name is Kathy Sha and I am currently a third year computer science and design major at Northeastern University. I am passionate about software development work, and currently working on the web development team at Northeastern's Generate student-led product development studio. I recently just finished a co-op working as a data visualization software developer at Novartis NIBR that inspired me to continue down this path of frontend engineering. I would love to expand my horizons to positions and projects looking into software development and design.

Coding Projects

Hover and click on a project

Northeastern's Generate is a student-led studio supporting entrepreneurs with product development. Created using libraries such as React, and Strapi as Headless CMS, the revamped site features unique design and development decisions showcasing the studio's fresh new branding.
Demo

2021-Present

Generate

A Web Development course final project cloning Netflix, however, uses an API to allow users to watch trailers instead of movies. Added in features of the site include having users be able to create personal profiles to interact, follow, and chat with other profiles, as well as keep a favorites tab of trailers they liked.
Demo Github

2022

Trailer Park

A Twitter clone project made using multiple Javascript libraries including jQuery, React, Redux, as well as Node.js for back-end webdevelopment, and MongoDB for the database supporting the site. Users are able to create tweets, heart and delete tweets.
Link Github

2021

Twitter Clone

An Experience and Interaction course tactical media project geared towards having a poetic purpose rather than a technical one. The site seems to be a standard shopping space, however, a pop-up will determine the rest of the user experience. Visit the site by clicking the link or visit the Github for a project description!
Link Github

2020

Réalisation Jeans

A website tackling homelessness in NYC containing a variety of information and resources that are available to increase awareness surrounding homelessness, and to encourage people to become actively involved in working to solve this issue.
Link Github

2019

CommonGround
